attributes.action: review the current SE Trains Franchise and timetables
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We request the DfT to urgently address the abysmal service on the North Kent Line to London since the imposed new timetable in December 2009.  

1 The failure of the near empty peak-hour trains to St Pancras whilst the reduced services to Victoria and Cannon Street are overcrowded be urgently addressed by reinstating original services.  

2 The defect in the timetable which extends journey times be addressed by the removal of extra stops at Longfield and Meopham.

3 That regulation of trains in the London area is examined to ensure longer-distance trains are no longer delayed.

4 The routing of trains between Chislehurst and London Bridge be investigated to ensure proper segregation of ‘fast’ and ‘stopping’ trains.

5 The failure of SE trains to offer a service as soon as any adverse condition occurs be investigated.

6 The DfT organise, as a matter of urgency, a public meeting in the evening in the Medway Towns.

7 Push SE Trains for a fair compensation scheme for annual season ticket holders.
